intro: Serjania lethalis, commonly known as the deadly serjania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain toxic seeds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with caution.
